ext_descriptions.ext_description: A port_property_type lists the valid types of a model port.
specifies a string type;
specifies a boolean type;
specifies a logical type;
specifies a numeric type;
specifies a physical type;
A signal_flow_direction lists the valid qualifiers of signal direction for network simulation.
specifies that direction is unknown;
specifies that direction is not applicable;
specifies that direction is output direction;
specifies that direction is input direction;
specifies that signal flow is bidirectional;

ext_description.p:
An Analytical_model_port_assignment is a relationship established between an
and an assigned_item. The assignment is established for the purpose of assigning explicit behaviour to a product aspect as accessed through the assigned_item.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the the item that is to be associated with an
in a .

specifies the
that is to be associated with an assigned item in an Analytical_model_port_assignment.

ext_description.p: specifies the role of the for the Analytical_model_port_assignment.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The combination of assigned_analytical_model_port, assigned_item and associated_analytical_model_application shall be unique within a population of the Analytical_model_port_assignment.

ext_description.p:
The of assigned_analytical_model_port shall be the
of associated_analytical_model_application.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Analytical_model_application is a type of . An Analytical_model_application is the association of specific data to an
in order to unambiguously characterize some behaviour of a real or imaginary object. The behaviour exhibited by the model in a specific environment or for a range of environments for a specific experiment is an analog of behaviour exhibited by the real or imaginary object when subjected to operational conditions.
Specific expectations for the correlation of the behaviour exhibited by the model and the behaviour of the object modeled may be identified by assigning requirements to the model.

specifies the
as the basis model for the Analytical_model_application.

ext_description.p: for the Analytical_model_application. The model_parameter_assignment binds instance data to data slots in the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: For each parameter declared in a model definition, an actual value must be assigned when that model is referenced, unless there is a default assignment included in the source code for the model.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
attribute inherited from
shall be unique within a population of Analytical_model_application.

ext_description.p: An Across_port_variable is a type of . An Across_port_variable maps a unit to an interface point for an and assigns an identifier to the mapping. This standard does not enumerate a fixed list of allowed "across unit". A unit is required.
ext_description.note: Physical macro level models require across variables to occur in pairs but that is not formalized in this standard.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The inherited from shall exist.

An Analog_analytical_model_port is a type of
that defines an analog context. An analog context is a context where the domain values are not a discrete, enumerated set of values.

ext_description.p:
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Analog_analytical_model_port is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Analog_analytical_model_port as its . There shall be one or more Port_variable for a particular Analog_analytical_model_port.
ext_description.note: A port may have more than one signal variable because so-called "through" and "across" variables are properties of the same analog port[3].

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Analytical_model_definition is a type of . An Analytical_model_definition is a mathematical description of the properties of a system that uses a particular computer interpretable language and provides a formally specified mechanism to access the description.
In this part of ISO 10303 an Analytical_model_definition includes the variable declarations of the mathematical description but may not include the assignment of actual values for the variables declared. Assignment of actual values is accomplished in .
This part of ISO 10303 provides support for computer systems to verify type consistency between product data defined in this part of ISO 10303 and product data captured by Analytical_model_definition.
This part of ISO 10303 describes the interfaces (ports) to an Analytical_model_definition and provides support for type checking of the units used for the parameters that may be assigned values for an Analytical_model_definition.
Figure 1 is an example of the case where actual values are not included: the Analytical_model_definition for a resistor that is coded in pseudocode.
Analytical_model_definition of a resistor
When the Analytical_model_definition is referenced by an , literals will be supplied for parameters declared in the interface and the simulator must ensure that types are compatible.
Usually the system is exercised in experiments to evaluate the usefulness of the system in the intended application.
The language syntax and semantics of an Analytical_model_definition are not specified by this part of ISO 10303.
This part of ISO 10303 provides complete support for exchange of units, including SI units, derived units, and user declared units.
This part of ISO 10303 provides complete support for prefixes of units.

ext_description.p:
the
of which the
provides a characterization.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Analytical_model_definition is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Analytical_model_definition as its . There shall be one or more
for a particular Analytical_model_definition. Figure 1 illustrates the use of parameter.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Analytical_model_definition is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Analytical_model_definition as its . There shall be one or more
for an Analytical_model_definition.

specifies the role of the
for an Analytical_model_definition. The source_code contains the source code for the Analytical_model_definition. Figure 1 illustrates how a source_code is specified and coded.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Analytical_model_definition is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Analytical_model_definition as its . The reference_document includes interface specifications for Analytical_models of interest to the enterprise.

ext_description.p:
specifies the
that defines the semantics and syntax of the computer interpretable strings in which the Analytical_model_definition will be encoded. Figure 1 illustrates how the representation_language is specified and coded.
ext_description.note: Only representation_languages that use characters from the ASCII code are supported by this part of ISO 10303.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Analytical_model_make_from_relationship is a type of . An Analytical_model_make_from_relationship establishes a relationship between an analytical model selected for reuse and the new analytical model that results from the reuse.
specifies an that is the result of the reuse for the Analytical_model_make_from_relationship.
specifies an to be used for the Analytical_model_make_from_relationship.
The reusable_model shall not be the resultant_model.
The combination of reusable_model and resultant_model shall be unique within a population of Analytical_model_make_from_relationship.

An Analytical_model_parameter is a type of . An Analytical_model_parameter is a formally declared variable of the provided for an external application to populate at execution time in a computing environment.
In Spice, temperature is an Analytical_model_parameter that may be set at the execution time.
specifies the for which the parameter is being established.
The combination of the and accessed_analytical_model shall be unique within a population of Analytical_model_parameter.

ext_description.p:
An Analytical_model_port is a description of an interface point for an . An Analytical_model_port may be an , or additionally may be one of an
or a .
ext_description.note:
These points are the points at which a simulator allows a user to stimulate an application of an
or to evaluate the response of an application of an
to a stimulus in an experiment. In this context, application includes the reference to the
and the literals required for the parameters as provided by a member of . A simulator that enforces conservative laws enforces that the energy entering an application of an
must be the same as that leaving the same applicaton of the . The structure of the port is not visible merely by accessing this information. The subtypes of this object provide more visibility into the underlying structure as appropriate. Members of the subtype tree of this object are populated as needed by an application in order to disclose the appropriate level of detail. The specialization in the subtypes of this object occur as a result of being more specific about certain properties of the port.

ext_description.p: specifies the string that represents an identifier, understandable by the end user, for this Analytical_model_port.
ext_description.note:
The port_name is documented in the
for the .

ext_description.p:
specifies the
that contains this Analytical_model_port.
ext_description.note:
Containment in this case means that if a member of
is deleted from the information base then the members of Analytical_model_port that are contained in that member of
are also deleted.

Containment in this case also means that the visibility of the name of an Analytical_model_port is limited to the
that is the accessed_analytical_model.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The combination of the port_name and the accessed_analytical_model shall be unique within a population of Analytical_model_port.

An Analytical_model_port_make_from_relationship is a make from relationship between a reused port and a resultant port that supports the reuse of a model definition in a different context where it is useful to have traceability to the source model.
specifies one role of the for the Analytical_model_port_make_from_relationship.
specifies one role of the for the Analytical_model_port_make_from_relationship.
specifies an for the Analytical_model_port_make_from_relationship.
The reusable_feature shall not be the resultant_feature.
The referenced by the reusable_feature shall not be the referenced by the resultant_feature.
The combination of reusable_feature and resultant_feature shall be unique within a population of Analytical_model_port_make_from_relationship.

ext_description.p: An Analytical_model_scalar_port is a type of that has a size of exactly one. The Analytical_model_scalar_port is used if there is a requirement to specify the cardinality of the ports associated by a relationship entity.
ext_description.example: Some examples are in the allocation to a functional unit terminal definition for analysis, or in mapping between a distributed model and a lumped equivalent circuit model, or in mapping to a vector port specified in an external syntax.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The port size shall be one.

ext_description.p: Analytical_model_scalar_port shall contain self as the only item of inherited from .

An Analytical_model_vector_port is a type of that has a size that may be greater than one. An Analytical_model_vector_port may be an . This part of ISO 10303 does not predefine the elements of a vector port.
ext_description.note: The cardinality of the structured port is known and a list of names is specified for it.
ext_description.example: Examples are bus ports, multi-degrees-of-freedom connections, microwave domain modes, and address and data bus definitions.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the integer for the cardinality of the Analytical_model_vector_port.
specifies a role of the for the Analytical_model_vector_port.

A Digital_analytical_model_port is a type of
that defines a digital context. A Digital_analytical_model_port is a .
In this part of ISO 10303, a high impedance port state is considered to be a value assigned during a simulation and is not a type declaration. It is represented by a string value assigned in accordance with the language reference manual. In the case that four state logic is used for simulation, that is "zero", "one", "unknown", "inactive" the property type shall be explicitly declared as a string because ISO 10303-11 does not define four state logic. Other more complex valued logic shall also use string property type declaration.
The
provides a mechanism to assign specific experimental values captured in
to an application of a
in a functional netlist context. Specifically, the
applies values to a
which provides the required facility to declare the logical value of the terminal independent of the signal value on the network node.
A
may declare that the
with an identifier of "output valid" is "inactive" for the same event or at the same time mark that the
for the network node the terminal is assigned to is declared to be a "true" value.
The permitted combinations of relationships between node value and terminal values is defined in the language reference manual for the simulation environment and is outside the scope of this part of ISO 10303.
The
provides a mechanism to exchange experimental values of the time or event dependent data.

specifies the
for the Digital_analytical_model_port. The port_type specifies one of a boolean_property_type, a logical_property_type, or a string_property_type.

specifies the
for the Digital_analytical_model_port. The nominal_signal_flow_direction specifies either bidirectional, input_direction, or output_direction for the Digital_analytical_model_port.

ext_description.p: not_applicable is not an allowed value for nominal_signal_flow_direction.
numeric_property_type is not an allowed value for port_type.
physical_property_type is not an allowed value for port_type.
unknown_direction is not an allowed value for nominal_signal_flow_direction.
A Port_variable is a mapping of a unit to an interface point for an and assigns an identifier to the mapping. A Port_variable may be one of a , or an , or a .
ext_description.note: When modeling physical systems at the macroscopic level, energy equations demand the ability to specify a through variable and an across variable for the same port.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the string for the descriptive label for the unit of measure of the value of a property associated with the simulated physical phenomenon exchanged through a member of the Port_variable. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The representation of the unit_of_measure is in accordance with ISO 10303-41.

ext_description.p: specifies the string that represents an identifier, understandable by the end user, for this Port_variable.
ext_description.note: The variable_name is documented in the for the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the that contains this Port_variable.
The combination of the variable_name and the associated_port shall be unique within a population of Port_variable.
A Terminal_pair_port_equivalence_relationship is the association between a pair of scalar ports and a single distributed port that declares an equivalence relationship in some simulation context.

ext_description.p: specifies the two in the ordered sequence for the Terminal_pair_port_equivalence_relationship. The second scalar port is always the reference port. Other details depend on the specific domain of the .
ext_description.example:
Port "INPUT" of a microwave coaxial filter model is the equivalent_port for this example.
Port "INPUT center pin" is the first for this example. Port "INPUT shield" is the second for this example.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the that represents the single distributed port for the Terminal_pair_port_equivalence_relationship.
Size of of scalar_ports shall be two.

ext_description.p: A Through_port_variable is a type of . A Through_port_variable maps a unit that is identified as a "through unit" to an interface point for an and assigns an identifier to the mapping. This standard does not enumerate a fixed list of allowed "through unit". A unit is required.
ext_description.example: An is a "through unit". A temperature is an "across unit". Reference: ISO 10303-41.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The inherited from shall exist.

ext_description.p: A Transform_port_variable is a type of . A Transform_port_variable supports the creation of directed graph based definitions if the nominal_signal_flow_direction is limited to input or output only. A Transform_port_variable may map a unit to an interface point for an . This standard does not enumerate a fixed list of allowed "transform unit".
ext_description.example:
A Laplace transform based
would use a Transform_port_variable as the
for input and output ports.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies either input_direction, output_direction, or unknown_direction for the Transform_port_variable.

ext_description.p: not_applicable is not an allowed value for nominal_signal_flow_direction.
bidirectional is not an allowed value for nominal_signal_flow_direction.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Analytical_model is a type of that is a mathematical description of the properties of a system.

There shall be two
with
'analytical model' and 'information' associated with an instance of Analytical_model through an instance of .

The
shall be unique within a population of Analytical_model.
An Analytical_model_application_assignment is a means to assign an for use in a network analysis.
the assigned_analytical_model specifies a role of the for the Analytical_model_application_assignment.
the assigned_item specifies a role of the for the Analytical_model_application_assignment.
An Analytical_model_version is a type of that provides a string indicating the revision of the analytical model for configuration control purposes.
specifies a role of the for the Analytical_model_version.

A Digital_analytical_model_vector_port is a type of and a type of that inherits cardinality from and context from . A Digital_analytical_model_vector_port provides the capability to exchange port vectors in the digital domain.
specifies an inverse relationship where the existence of the Digital_analytical_model_vector_port is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Digital_analytical_model_vector_port as its .
The inherited from shall be .
A Digital_analytical_model_scalar_port is a type of and a type of . A Digital_analytical_model_scalar_port cardinality is inherited from and the data typing is inherited from .
The rule analytical_model_definition_constraint constrains the use of as to only.

There shall not be any instance of that refers as
and is not an instance of .
The rule analytical_model_version_constraint constrains the use of as to only.

There shall not be any instance of that refers as
and is not an instance of .
